rubenchristoffer.hetty

Class HTTPCookieJar

  • java.lang.Object
    • rubenchristoffer.hetty.HTTPCookieJar

  • public class HTTPCookieJar
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a HTTP Cookie Jar. This holds a list of validated cookies and allows to check which cookies should be used when sending a request to a given URL.
    Author:
    Ruben Christoffer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HTTPCookieJar()
      Creates an empty HTTPCookieJar.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(java.lang.String cookieName)
      Checks if the cookie jar contains a cookie with the given cookieName.
      java.util.List<HTTPValidatedCookie> getCookieJar()
      Returns list of all cookies in jar.
      java.util.List<HTTPValidatedCookie> getCookies(java.lang.String cookieName)
      Gets cookies with the given cookieName.
      HTTPValidatedCookie[] getCookiesFor(java.net.URL urlToValidate)
      Gets cookies for a given URL.
      int indexOf(java.lang.String cookieName)
      Gets the index of the first cookie by the given cookieName.
      void setCookie(HTTPValidatedCookie cookie)
      Sets / adds cookie based on name of cookie object.
      void setCookies(HTTPValidatedCookie... cookies)
      Same as setCookie(HTTPValidatedCookie), but performs this on multiple cookies instead of one.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPCookieJar

        public HTTPCookieJar()
        Creates an empty HTTPCookieJar.

    • Method Detail

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(java.lang.String cookieName)
        Gets the index of the first cookie by the given cookieName.
        Parameters:
        cookieName - is the name of the cookie
        Returns:
        index of the cookie if it is found, -1 otherwise

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String cookieName)
        Checks if the cookie jar contains a cookie with the given cookieName.
        Parameters:
        cookieName - is the name of the cookie
        Returns:
        true if found in list, false otherwise

      • getCookies

        public java.util.List<HTTPValidatedCookie> getCookies(java.lang.String cookieName)
        Gets cookies with the given cookieName.
        Parameters:
        cookieName - is the name of the cookie(s)
        Returns:
        read-only wrapper list that is always up-to-date

      • setCookie

        public void setCookie(HTTPValidatedCookie cookie)
        Sets / adds cookie based on name of cookie object. Replaces the first cookie with same name if it exists.
        Parameters:
        cookie - is the cookie object you want to add

      • setCookies

        public void setCookies(HTTPValidatedCookie... cookies)
        Same as setCookie(HTTPValidatedCookie), but performs this on multiple cookies instead of one.
        Parameters:
        cookies - the cookies you want to set

      • getCookiesFor

        public HTTPValidatedCookie[] getCookiesFor(java.net.URL urlToValidate)
        Gets cookies for a given URL. This is useful to filter out only the cookies that should be sent to a given host.
        Parameters:
        urlToValidate - the URL you want cookies for
        Returns:
        an array of validated HTTP cookies

      • getCookieJar

        public java.util.List<HTTPValidatedCookie> getCookieJar()
        Returns list of all cookies in jar.
        Returns:
        read-only wrapper list that is always up-to-date
